abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Industrial Restructuring Project (IRP)
            in Indonesia. The project's main objective was to
            increase the supply of unsubsidized term finance and
            high-quality technical assistance to enterprises undergoing
            restructuring in three industrial subsectors namely
            textiles, pulp and paper, and engineering. Bank’s
            performance was satisfactory. Borrower’s performance was
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned are as follows: (i)
            the experience with the IRP confirmed the validity of the
            Bank's Operational Directive on Financial Sector
            Operations; (ii) support for the provision of technical
            services to firms needs to be driven by the demands of those
            enterprises, rather than be supply driven, and should be
            based on supporting measures to improve the public and
            private provision of those services; (iii) build into
            projects systems to monitor subproject implementation
            results and TA impact; and, (iv) successful execution of
            studies requires participation of all stakeholders
            throughout the process, and adequate capacity in the
            implementing agencies to manage them effectively.
